brief_title: Ultraviolet Light Therapy for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
brief_summary: OBJECTIVES: I. Evaluate the mechanisms of ultraviolet A-1 light therapy in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus and normal controls.
detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE: Treatment with ultraviolet A-1 light is administered 5 days a week for 6 weeks, at the lowest dose or frequency required to maintain a response. The dose and frequency are progressively decreased over the next 9 weeks.
criteria: PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA: --Disease Characteristics-- Patients ages 15 to 70 with symptomatic systemic lupus erythematosus meeting American Rheumatism Association criteria and normal controls --Prior/Concurrent Therapy-- No requirement for tetracycline or other photosensitizing drugs
